## maximum independent set
* graphclasses.org: [maximum independent set](https://www.graphclasses.org/classes/par_8.html)
* [â†—](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximal_independent_set) For a graph $G=(V,E)$, an independent set $S$ is a maximal independent set if for $v \in V$, one of the following is true: 1) $v \in S$ 2), $N(v) \cap S \ne \emptyset$ where $N(v)$ denotes the neighbors of $v$. ... the largest maximum independent set of a graph is called a maximum independent set.
